solar_systems.name: Alpha Centauri
solar_systems.description: Alpha Centauri is the closest star system and closest planetary system to Earth's Solar System at 4.37 light-years from the Sun.

planets.name: Proxima Centauri b
planets.description: Proxima Centauri b is an exoplanet orbiting in the habitable zone of the red dwarf star Proxima Centauri.

planets.name: Proxima Centauri c
planets.description: Proxima Centauri c is a confirmed exoplanet, orbiting the red dwarf star Proxima Centauri.

solar_systems.name: TRAPPIST-1
solar_systems.description: TRAPPIST-1 is an ultra-cool red dwarf star that is slightly larger but much more massive than the planet Jupiter, located 39.6 light-years from the Sun.

planets.name: TRAPPIST-1 b
planets.description: TRAPPIST-1 b is the innermost planet and is likely to have a rocky composition.

planets.name: TRAPPIST-1 c
planets.description: TRAPPIST-1 c is the second innermost planet and is composed primarily of rock and iron.
